title: Give a Gift to Yourself with These Awesome SF Holiday Events

seo_title: Give a Gift to Yourself with These Awesome SF Holiday Events
meta_description: Give a Gift to Yourself with These Awesome 2017 SF Holiday Events
short_description: A new year is around the corner and, like almost everyone at this time of year, you’ve probably been busy, busy, busy. So why not take some time for yourself, slow down, and enjoy the holidays a little bit here in SF?
long_description:
A new year is around the corner and, like almost everyone at this time of year, you’ve probably been busy, busy, busy. Last-minute shopping, family obligations, holiday parties at work — all good, but it all adds up and makes the season fly by too fast. Before you know, it will be 2018 and this year will be a memory.

So why not take some time for yourself, slow down, and enjoy the holidays a little bit here in SF?

At SCH we’ve got a holiday package to help you establish a little home away from home for a few days. And the city has plenty of things happening that will help you recharge your batteries and head into the new year a little less shell-shocked.

It’s a really good strategy if you want to make 2018 a #NeverStopStartingUp kind of year.  

Tis the Season for Science

’Tis the Season for Science: Life on Ice is the California Academy of Science’s annual holiday exhibit celebrating the remarkable adaptations that allow Arctic and Antarctic animals to thrive in snowy ecosystems. Learn how plants and animals brave the planet’s most extreme environments — and lace up your skates for a spin around the new ice rink!

Where: Golden Gate Park, 55 Music Concourse Drive
When: November 22, 2017 - January 7, 2018

A Christmas Carol

Featuring a lively cast of dozens, gorgeous costumes, and some spooky ghosts, the Bay Area's favorite holiday tradition returns with a sparkling, music-infused production of A Christmas Carol.

Where: A.C.T.'s Geary Theater, 415 Geary Street
When: December 1 - 24, 2017

A Charlie Brown Christmas—Live!

See Charlie Brown, Snoopy, Linus, Lucy, and the entire Peanuts gang bring a television classic to life. With live actors, an animated backdrop, and Vince Guaraldi’s timeless music performed by the San Francisco Symphony, A Charlie Brown Christmas offers a fresh spin on a classic, family-friendly tale.

Where: Davies Symphony Hall, 201 Van Ness Ave
When: December 21 - 24, 2017

Winter Walk SF

It’s a one-of-a-kind holiday pop-up plaza in the heart of Union Square. For five weeks, Winter Walk SF brings open-air cocktail gardens, food trucks, live performances, carolers, holiday-themed photo opportunities, and lots of family-friendly activities to Union Square.

Where: Union Square
When: November 25 - December 31, 2017

The Nutcracker, San Francisco Ballet

See The Nutcracker in a historic setting — the San Francisco’s War Memorial Opera House is where the now-famous ballet made its American premiere on Christmas Eve in 1944.

Where: War Memorial Opera House, 301 Van Ness Avenue
When: December 13 - 30, 2017
